commit_message:
Merge tag '8.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 8.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 8.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: Ibbc7cdfd02797ba31c9816f644c3d4fa37acf6d7

commit_message:
Improved SQL tests

SQL injection payloads and error strings are now similar to that of SQLmap

Change-Id: I13c041ed25be7c130e20306e828c7bd149df4da2
Implements: blueprint/test-fuzz-sql-improve

commit_message:
Add setting default max_burst value if not given by user

If user will not provide burst value for bandwidth limit rule there is
need to set such value on appropriate to ensure that bandwith limit
will work fine.
To ensure at least proper limitation of TCP traffic we decided to set
burst as 80% of bw_limit value.
LinuxBridge agent already sets is like that. This patch add same
behaviour for QoS extension driver in openvswitch L2 agent.

DocImpact: Add setting default max_burst value in LB and OvS drivers

Change-Id: Ib12a7cbf88cdffd10c8f6f8442582bf7377ca27d
Closes-Bug: #1572670

commit_message:
Remove Nova EC2 HAproxy endpoint

THT does not deploy Nova EC2 anymore, so we don't need the HAproxy
endpoint anymore.

Change-Id: Ia888fe7e14c736ef3678d9a7cf69a2deb9233342
Depends-On: Ief2d0e5c77b5ac58560606fee930fbd66c40ffc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/61/316361/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Make info caching work across subrequests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 22:58:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ee626a9700a50fb1a3055f43b210da394add9f80', 'message': "Make info caching work across subrequests

Previously, if you called get_account_info, get_container_info, or
get_object_info, then the results of that call would be cached in the
WSGI environment as top-level keys. This is okay, except that if you,
in middleware, copy the WSGI environment and then make a subrequest
using the copy, information retrieved in the subrequest isn't cached
only in the copy and not in the original. This can mean lots of extra
trips to memcache for, say, SLO validation where the segments are in
another container; the object HEAD ends up getting container info for
the segment container, but then the next object HEAD gets it again.

This commit moves the cache for get_*_info into a dictionary at
environ['swift.infocache']; this way, you can shallow-copy the request
environment and still get the benefits from the cache.

Change-Id: I3481b38b41c33cd1e39e19baab56193c5f9bf6ac

commit_message:
Make info caching work across subrequests

Previously, if you called get_account_info, get_container_info, or
get_object_info, then the results of that call would be cached in the
WSGI environment as top-level keys. This is okay, except that if you,
in middleware, copy the WSGI environment and then make a subrequest
using the copy, information retrieved in the subrequest is cached
only in the copy and not in the original. This can mean lots of extra
trips to memcache for, say, SLO validation where the segments are in
another container; the object HEAD ends up getting container info for
the segment container, but then the next object HEAD gets it again.

This commit moves the cache for get_*_info into a dictionary at
environ['swift.infocache']; this way, you can shallow-copy the request
environment and still get the benefits from the cache.

Change-Id: I3481b38b41c33cd1e39e19baab56193c5f9bf6ac

subject: Fix use of a renamed itertools function in python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 09:40:26.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/62818c3069bdb8fa42fa973e899d163c1ef91d54', 'message': 'Fix use of a renamed itertools function in python3

In python3 izip functions got renamed to zip in itertools module.
This was breaking support for python3.

Change-Id: I6fda87b78e40be134d7c94698cca5d85a51eb989
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of a renamed itertools function in python3

In python3 izip functions got renamed to zip in itertools module.
This was breaking support for python3.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated verbose option

Upstream puppet-oslo commit Ic05e3744046be622314f7f16c839d2323818b353
deprecates paramater 'DEFAUTL/verbose' and removes it from configs.
Hence we need update library as well.

Change-Id: I5cf708cc3bcba058bc28b4e84d351108e713d3e3
Closes-bug: #1582221

commit_message:
Remove Nova EC2 deployment

Nova EC2 does not exist anymore since Mitaka, parameters are already
deprecated in Mitaka and send warnings to the Puppet catalog.
The service has been replaced by ec2api project, where Puppet OpenStack
team is currently writting a module.

In the meantime we add support in TripleO, this patch removes all
occurences of Nova EC2 configuration, which are useless and send
warnings for nothing.

Change-Id: Ief2d0e5c77b5ac58560606fee930fbd66c40ffc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/316360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve the help text for the API options (4)

The previous commit moved several of the non-deprecated legacy API
options to a central location. This commit adds additional help text to
those options.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Ic92631fd5de2a6ff6d1802bef71cbf6aca0039f5

commit_message:
Add os-api-ref

This adds the new os-api-ref library to global requirements. This is a
sphinx extension which assists in building api reference sites for
OpenStack projects.

It is licensed under Apache 2

It is only used by ``tox -e api-ref`` targets in projects, so need not
be packaged by distros.

Change-Id: I0e615d36a2e5a8fa0d83f20bdcc2c33ad868ebd5

commit_message:
Allow ipmi_priv_level to be configured for the ipmitool driver

The ipmi_priv_level option is used to configure the privilege level for
the IPMI user used to manage that node.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 06:08:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d678830cb22c44f4d5babf864d59a718206e2c1e', 'message': 'Huawei: Do not do split if replication pair abnormal

In Huawei cinder volume driver, replication feature will fail to
failover when there is a primary array error. The Implemented failover
steps:
  1. Split replication pair;
  2. Make the second pair readable & writable.

When primary and secondary array are normal, the split will succeed.
But when primary array is error, the split command sent to secondary
will fail, so failover will fail.

When error occurred on primary or secondary array, the running status
of replication pair will be abnormal (ERRUPTED). If the status is in
this case we should not do split.

Change-Id: Icf91ca7c9e3d3962277c4c4f70e783f80bbe2f77
Closes-Bug: #1564199

commit_message:
Huawei: Do not do split if replication pair abnormal

In Huawei cinder volume driver, replication feature will fail to
failover when there is a primary array error. The Implemented failover
steps:
  1. Split replication pair;
  2. Make the second pair readable & writable.

When primary and secondary array are normal, the split will succeed.
But when primary array is error, the split command sent to secondary
will fail, so failover will fail.

When error occurred on primary or secondary array, the running status
of replication pair will be abnormal (ERRUPTED). If the status is in
this case we should not do split.

Change-Id: Icf91ca7c9e3d3962277c4c4f70e783f80bbe2f77
Closes-Bug: #1564199
(cherry picked from commit 11805628279cc49c8172f0296fd8048fd96b977b)

commit_message:
Update resources subnet CIDR

During resources phase resources subnet is created with the same CIDR
as during setup. Ironic requires to have a route to this network.
This patch allow to set resources subnet CIDR via RESOURCES_FIXED_RANGE and
resources subnet gateway via RESOURCES_NETWORK_GATEWAY variables.
The patch change default CIDR for resources network to 10.2.0.0/20

Change-Id: I19735cb6e1ccdfc602a99f39459ed61a229fbaa4

commit_message:
Add 'cephx' access type

The 'cephx' access-type is available in the latest API microversion
and in some of the earlier versions. It was introduced in API
microversion 2.13. Add it as a choice of access type in the dashboard.

Change-Id: I7bc7b4170e22988668ff5293a6e7d7672cba7cd9
Closes-Bug: #1581932

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import six from tempest.api.dns import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import exceptions from tempest import test class RecordsTest(base.BaseDnsTest): _interface = 'json' @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(RecordsTest, cls).setUpClass() cls.client = cls.dns_records_client # Creates domains and Records for testcase cls.setup_records = list() name = data_utils.rand_name('domain') + '.com.' email = data_utils.rand_name('dns') + '@testmail.com' _, cls.domain = cls.dns_domains_client.create_zone(name, email) # Creates a record with type as A r_name = 'www.' + name data1 = "192.0.2.3" _, record = cls.client.create_record( domain_id=cls.domain['id'], name=r_name, data=data1, type='A') cls.setup_records.append(record) # Creates a record with type AAAA data2 = "2001:db8:0:1234:0:5678:9:12" _, record = cls.client.create_record( domain_id=cls.domain['id'], name=r_name, data=data2, type='AAAA') cls.setup_records.append(record) @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): for record in cls.setup_records: cls.client.delete_record(cls.domain['id'], record['id']) cls.dns_domains_client.delete_zone(cls.domain['id']) def _delete_record(self, domain_id, record_id): self.client.delete_record(domain_id, record_id) self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.get_record, domain_id, record_id) @test.attr(type='gate') def test_list_records_for_domain(self): # Get a list of records for a domain _, records = self.client.list_records(self.domain['id']) # Verify records created in setup class are in the list for record in self.setup_records: self.assertIn(record['id'], six.moves.map(lambda x: x['id'], records)) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_update_get_delete_record(self): # Create Zone name = data_utils.rand_name('domain') + '.com.' email = data_utils.rand_name('dns') + '@testmail.com' _, domain = self.dns_domains_client.create_zone(name, email) self.addCleanup(self.dns_domains_client.delete_zone, domain['id']) # Create Record r_name = 'www.' + name r_data = "192.0.2.4" _, record = self.client.create_record(domain_id=domain['id'], name=r_name, data=r_data, type='A') self.addCleanup(self._delete_record, domain['id'], record['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(record['id']) self.assertEqual(domain['id'], record['domain_id']) self.assertEqual(r_name, record['name']) self.assertEqual(r_data, record['data']) self.assertEqual('A', record['type']) # Update Record with data and ttl r_data1 = "192.0.2.5" r_ttl = 3600 _, update_record = self.client.update_record(domain_id=domain['id'], record_id=record['id'], name=r_name, type='A', data=r_data1, ttl=r_ttl) self.assertEqual(r_data1, update_record['data']) self.assertEqual(r_ttl, update_record['ttl']) # GET record _, get_record = self.client.get_record(domain_id=domain['id'], record_id=record['id']) self.assertEqual(update_record['data'], get_record['data']) self.assertEqual(update_record['name'], get_record['name']) self.assertEqual(update_record['type'], get_record['type']) self.assertEqual(update_record['ttl'], get_record['ttl']) self.assertEqual(update_record['domain_id'], get_record['domain_id'])

commit_message:
Port V1 Tempest test from designate's contrib folder

These are a close to a straight port as was possible, no cleanup was
performed where it wasn't absolutly necessary.

In addition, we add flags to enable V1, V2, Admin API tests, and a
V1 servers API flag, as these tests have proved particularly
susceptible to race conditions.

Change-Id: Idc31c00c95fde96087f4f222ae9c17e554e6b1fc

commit_message:
Bump voluptuous to 0.8.9

A change proposed by myself into voluptuous was released
in 0.8.9 and it will be used by tooz for options validation
so having the ability to use this version would make it
possible for a tooz review to continue forward.

Change-Id: Ie62f01b62bbba905d054410aec2b8f1265f9b1fb

commit_message:
use nthhost() instead of ipaddr('address') filter

use nthhost(1) instead of ipaddr('address') to get the first address
in a cidr range (because the former works, while the latter fails).

Change-Id: I4fab9b67a27e560b07f96aee5e5ca6f7345cd78d
Closes-Bug: #1581608

commit_message:
add the option to specify an alternative requirements file

It is handy to be able to specify an alternative requirements file
for developers when they need to test different requirements or
when using additional third party ansible roles.  There are
several roles on github/redhat-openstack/ansible-role that
can be used to add features and functions to the quickstart.

Change-Id: Ifdf691915e7972e8b2992cd6b90d37abbfc825ec

commit_message:
Network driver should generate network configs

Currently the network task configures the network
configs, this means other driver cannot use the data
they need to.

Change-Id: I54bfa5ac9733a346d9d956f292f8463906252664
Closes-Bug: #1581303

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-11 13:51:00.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-hds-hnas-unconfined-09b79f3bdb24a83c.yaml', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hitachi/test_ssh.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hitachi/test_hds_hnas.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hitachi/ssh.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hitachi/hds_hnas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/02ed5e2918fa7c7dee422bfa4a1818c42889fe7b', 'message': "Fix HNAS error with unconfined filesystems

Unconfined filesystems created through CLI in HNAS caused driver's
parser to break. It was found that the command breaking could be
replaced by another, already used command, which also retrieves
filesystem information, and it is preferred, so previous command
has been replaced.

Additionally, administrator may not want to automatically mount
an unmounted filesystem in DHSS=False mode, which may be unmounted
for maintenance, so changed behavior to not mount automatically.

Closes-bug: #1571000
(cherry picked from commit 0d6de5088882331c575f3a6e837dbddc4af4adf5)

"}]
commit_message:
Fix HNAS error with unconfined filesystems

Unconfined filesystems created through CLI in HNAS caused driver's
parser to break. It was found that the command breaking could be
replaced by another, already used command, which also retrieves
filesystem information, and it is preferred, so previous command
has been replaced.

Additionally, administrator may not want to automatically mount
an unmounted filesystem in DHSS=False mode, which may be unmounted
for maintenance, so changed behavior to not mount automatically.

Closes-bug: #1571000
(cherry picked from commit 0d6de5088882331c575f3a6e837dbddc4af4adf5)

Change-Id: Id28cc7f929d00ef1e819f2325c7c8519979cfb16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/49/315049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mounted = self.hnas.check_fs_mounted() if not mounted: msg = _("Filesystem %s is not mounted.") % self.fs_name raise exception.HNASBackendException(msg=msg)
deleted_lines: if not self.hnas.check_fs_mounted(): LOG.debug("Filesystem %(fs)s is unmounted. Mounting...", {'fs': self.fs_name}) self.hnas.mount()

commit_message:
Fix rrset serialization, improve mdns tests

Code refactor and cleanup
Add port number logging

Change-Id: Ied150676166e038a005d73884788d406ad0e296c
Closes-Bug: #1550441
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/52/286552/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
from oslo_log import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def _send_request_to_mdns(self, req): """Send request to localhost""" port = self.service._dns_sock_udp.getsockname()[1] response = dns.query.udp(req, '127.0.0.1', port=port, timeout=1) LOG.info("
-- RESPONSE --
%s
--------------
" % response.to_text()) return response def _query_mdns(self, qname, rdtype, rdclass=dns.rdataclass.IN): """Send query to localhost""" req = dns.message.make_query(qname, rdtype, rdclass=rdclass) return self._send_request_to_mdns(req) def test_query(self): zone = self.create_zone() # Reply query for NS response = self._query_mdns(zone.name, dns.rdatatype.NS) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.NOERROR, response.rcode()) self.assertEqual(1, len(response.answer)) ans = response.answer[0] self.assertEqual(dns.rdatatype.NS, ans.rdtype) self.assertEqual(zone.name, ans.name.to_text()) self.assertEqual(zone.ttl, ans.ttl) # Reply query for SOA response = self._query_mdns(zone.name, dns.rdatatype.SOA) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.NOERROR, response.rcode()) self.assertEqual(1, len(response.answer)) ans = response.answer[0] self.assertEqual(dns.rdatatype.SOA, ans.rdtype) self.assertEqual(zone.name, ans.name.to_text()) self.assertEqual(zone.ttl, ans.ttl) # Refuse query for incorrect rdclass response = self._query_mdns(zone.name, dns.rdatatype.SOA, rdclass=dns.rdataclass.RESERVED0) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.REFUSED, response.rcode()) # Refuse query for ANY response = self._query_mdns("www.%s" % zone.name, dns.rdatatype.ANY) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.REFUSED, response.rcode()) # Reply query for A against inexistent record response = self._query_mdns("nope.%s" % zone.name, dns.rdatatype.A) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.REFUSED, response.rcode()) # Reply query for A recordset = self.create_recordset(zone) self.create_record(zone, recordset) response = self._query_mdns(recordset.name, dns.rdatatype.A) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.NOERROR, response.rcode()) self.assertEqual(1, len(response.answer)) ans = response.answer[0] self.assertEqual(dns.rdatatype.A, ans.rdtype) self.assertEqual(recordset.name, ans.name.to_text()) self.assertEqual(zone.ttl, ans.ttl) self.assertEqual('3600 IN A 192.0.2.1', str(ans.to_rdataset())) def test_query_axfr(self): zone = self.create_zone() # Query for AXFR response = self._query_mdns(zone.name, dns.rdatatype.AXFR) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.NOERROR, response.rcode()) self.assertEqual(2, len(response.answer)) ans = response.answer[0] # SOA self.assertEqual(dns.rdatatype.SOA, ans.rdtype) self.assertEqual(zone.name, ans.name.to_text()) self.assertEqual(zone.ttl, ans.ttl) ans = response.answer[1] # NS self.assertEqual(dns.rdatatype.NS, ans.rdtype) self.assertEqual(zone.name, ans.name.to_text()) self.assertEqual(zone.ttl, ans.ttl) def test_notify_notauth_primary_zone(self): zone = self.create_zone() # Send NOTIFY to mdns: NOTAUTH for primary zone notify = dns.message.make_query(zone.name, dns.rdatatype.SOA) notify.flags = 0 notify.set_opcode(dns.opcode.NOTIFY) notify.flags |= dns.flags.AA response = self._send_request_to_mdns(notify) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.NOTAUTH, response.rcode()) def test_notify_non_master(self): zone = self.create_zone(type='SECONDARY', email='test@example.com') # Send NOTIFY to mdns: refuse from non-master notify = dns.message.make_query(zone.name, dns.rdatatype.SOA) notify.flags = 0 notify.set_opcode(dns.opcode.NOTIFY) notify.flags |= dns.flags.AA response = self._send_request_to_mdns(notify) self.assertEqual(dns.rcode.REFUSED, response.rcode())

commit_message:
Only check to resolve DNS on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1

Since we don't have valid mirrors yet, we cannot fully configure nodes
in tripleo-test-cloud-rh1. However,  we need to ensure DNS can resolve
properly.

Change-Id: Ib8c3342e428716ed813dfb8055941bdf8910851b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/67/317067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$NODEPOOL_CLOUD" == "tripleo-test-cloud-rh1" ]; then # NOTE(pabelanger): We currently don't have a AFS mirror for # tripleo-test-cloud-rh1. However to avoid writing duplicate scripts, we # need to make sure DNS resolved properly. exit 0 fi

subject: api-ref: finish validation for os-server-external-events.inc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-11 18:50:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/58bcb1cf1cf7d6dbd04ac61b6fa274330f91a602', 'message': "api-ref: finish validation for os-server-external-events.inc

This completes the validation for the admin event interface, including
detailing the codes we currently return in the parameter list.

Because os-service was incorrectly using the 'status' key, when I
renamed status => event_status I needed to also create a
service_status to make things compile. It's accurate enough to move
forward.

Because this is really a Neutron only API, this is moved towards the
bottom of the API list, to make it clear this isn't really designed to
be used by end user apps.

Change-Id: I3ed46eec1c33a63b7a89d6d6b5eeda574effdc56

commit_message:
api-ref: finish validation for os-server-external-events.inc

This completes the validation for the admin event interface, including
detailing the codes we currently return in the parameter list.

Because os-service was incorrectly using the 'status' key, when I
renamed status => event_status I needed to also create a
service_status to make things compile. It's accurate enough to move
forward.

Because this is really a Neutron only API, this is moved towards the
bottom of the API list, to make it clear this isn't really designed to
be used by end user apps.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I3ed46eec1c33a63b7a89d6d6b5eeda574effdc56

deleted_lines: - status: status - status: status - status: status - status: status

commit_message:
config options: Improve the help text for the 'spice' options

This change enhances the help text for the spice configuration options.

Blueprint centralize-config-options

Change-Id: I7691fdae78cd1b70856b6f2bed0dc8804ca79b94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/269910/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: spice_opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(GROUP_NAME, title="The spice console feature", help=""" The spice console feature allows you to connect to a guest. """) Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * VNC must be explicitly disabled to get access to the spice console. Set the enabled option to False in the [vnc] section to disable the VNC console. If you used the deprecated vnc_enabled option in the [DEFAULT] section, set it to False.Enable the spice guest agent support on the instances. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * NoneLocation of the spice HTML5 console proxy. This is the URL an end user would use to connect to the `nova-spicehtml5proxy`` service. This service then does the forwarding to the console of an instance. In order to use spice console, the service ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` needs to run. This service is typically executed on the controller node. Possible values: * Must be a valid URL of the form: ``http://host:port/spice_auto.html`` where host is the node running ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` and the port is typically 6082. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * This option depends on the ``html5proxy_host`` and ``html5proxy_port`` options. The access URL returned by the compute node must have the host and port where the ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` service is listening. """)Host on which the ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` service listens for incoming requests. Possible values: * Any valid interface IP address on the host. Services which consume this: * ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` Related options: * This option depends on the ``html5proxy_base_url`` option. The ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` service must be listening on a host that is accessible from the HTML5 client.Port on which the ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` service listens for incoming requests. Possible values: * Any valid port on the host. Services which consume this: * ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` Related options: * This option depends on the ``html5proxy_base_url`` option. The ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` service must be listening on a port that is accessible from the HTML5 client.The address on which the spice server running on the instances should listen. Typically, the ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` proxy client runs on the controller node and connects over the private network to this address on the compute node(s). Possible values: * Any valid IP address on the compute node. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * NoneThe address to which the ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` proxy client uses to connect to instance consoles. Typically, the ``nova-spicehtml5proxy`` proxy client runs on the controller node and connects over the private network to this address on the compute node(s). Possible values: * Any valid IP address on the compute node. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * This option depends on the ``server_listen`` option. The proxy client must be able to access the address specified in ``server_listen`` using the value of this option.A keyboard layout which is supported by the underlying hypervisor on this node. This is usually an 'IETF language tag' (for example 'en-us'). If you use QEMU as hypervisor, you should find the list of supported keyboard layouts at /usr/share/qemu/keymaps. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` Related options: * None
deleted_lines: spice_opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(GROUP_NAME)Enable the spice guest agent support.Location of spice HTML5 console proxy, in the form "http://127.0.0.1:6082/spice_auto.html" """) Host on which to listen for incoming requestsPort on which to listen for incoming requestsIP address on which instance spice server should listenThe address to which proxy clients (like nova-spicehtml5proxy) should connectKeymap for spice

commit_message:
Support xenial with swift-init service provider

Added function to check if ubuntu is < 16.04.
If ubuntu < 16.04 then default provider was upstart.
If ubuntu = 16.04 then use systemd support.

Closes-Bug: #1578408

Change-Id: Icb2d6ff5152e782066b957d5e6e74357496c6b28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/70/316270/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if !default_provider_upstart? if default_provider_upstart? elsif Puppet::FileSystem.exist?("/etc/systemd/system/#{resource[:pattern]}.service") current_conf = File.read("/etc/systemd/system/#{resource[:pattern]}.service") if !current_conf.eql? systemd_template return :false end if systemctl_run('is-enabled', [resource[:pattern]], false).exitstatus == 0 return :true end else return :false # file and notify systemctl. For Ubuntu < 16.04 create init file. if default_provider_upstart? print "cheese" file = Puppet::Type.type(:file).new( :name => "/etc/init/#{resource[:pattern]}.conf", :ensure => :present, :content => upstart_template, :mode => '0644' ) file.write(file) else print "tacos" # delete services file and notify systemctl. For Ubuntu < 16.04 if default_provider_upstart? File.delete("/etc/init/#{resource[:pattern]}.conf") else def default_provider_upstart? if Facter.value(:operatingsystem) == 'Ubuntu' && Facter.value(:operatingsystemmajrelease) < '16' return true else return false end end
deleted_lines: if Facter.value(:operatingsystem) != 'Ubuntu' if Facter.value(:operatingsystem) != 'Ubuntu' if Puppet::FileSystem.exist?("/etc/systemd/system/#{resource[:pattern]}.service") current_conf = File.read("/etc/systemd/system/#{resource[:pattern]}.service") if !current_conf.eql? systemd_template return :false end if systemctl_run('is-enabled', [resource[:pattern]], false).exitstatus == 0 return :true end else return :false end elsif Facter.value(:operatingsystem) == 'Ubuntu' # file and notify systemctl. For Ubuntu create init file. if Facter.value(:operatingsystem) != 'Ubuntu' elsif Facter.value(:operatingsystem) == 'Ubuntu' file = Puppet::Type.type(:file).new( :name => "/etc/init/#{resource[:pattern]}.conf", :ensure => :present, :content => upstart_template, :mode => '0644' ) file.write(file) # delete services file and notify systemctl. For Ubuntu if Facter.value(:operatingsystem) != 'Ubuntu' elsif Facter.value(:operatingsystem) == 'Ubuntu'

commit_message:
Add customer metadata dimensions in libvirt plugin

Allows seperate metadata dimensions for customer and operations project.
This is required to support heat auto scaling for customers.
Also includes some refactoring to help with pep8 complexity requirements

Change-Id: I25de19eb1efdbb485caf1de0f70128b5aa6494c8

commit_message:
Add watchdog to global-requirements

Introduction:

In oslo.reports we need to monitor file changes to generates Guru
Meditation Report.

Python support:

        The library currently supports Python 2.x to 3.5.

Community and development:

        As of writing this the latest update was on '04/04/2016'.
        The project has a public Git repo [1]

License:

        It's being distributed under the Apache License version 2.0.


[1] https://github.com/gorakhargosh/watchdog/

Related blueprint: guru-meditation-report-file-touch

Change-Id: Ifd27bfe6981b030f1b2c907752ef1a0d57691801

commit_message:
report info if parameters are out of order

This puts in the infrastructure for enforcing the section and
parameter name ordering in parameters.yaml file. It does so through
loading the lookup table as an ordered dict, and doing compare
operations to it during initial load.

The ordered dict loading is far more expensive than straight stream
loading, so a cache mechanism for file => loaded yaml is also
added. This reduces the sphinx build time to less than it was
previously, even though we are doing more processing of the data.

Once the parameters.yaml file is made compliant, we can move these
from .info to .warn and enforce the file stays alphabetized.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: Id30464d6326aec3ed7d82c178261d686e2509d33

added_lines: from collections import OrderedDict def ordered_load(stream, Loader=yaml.Loader, object_pairs_hook=OrderedDict): """Load yaml as an ordered dict This allows us to inspect the order of the file on disk to make sure it was correct """ class OrderedLoader(Loader): pass def construct_mapping(loader, node): loader.flatten_mapping(node) return object_pairs_hook(loader.construct_pairs(node)) OrderedLoader.add_constructor( yaml.resolver.BaseResolver.DEFAULT_MAPPING_TAG, construct_mapping) return yaml.load(stream, OrderedLoader) # cache for file -> yaml so we only do the load and check of a yaml # file once during a sphinx processing run. YAML_CACHE = {} def load_param_file(self, fpath): global YAML_CACHE if fpath in YAML_CACHE: return YAML_CACHE[fpath] lookup = ordered_load(stream) self._check_yaml_sorting(fpath, lookup) # print lookup YAML_CACHE[fpath] = lookup return lookup def _check_yaml_sorting(self, fpath, yaml_data): """check yaml sorting Assuming we got an ordered dict, we """ sections = {"header": 1, "path": 2, "query": 3, "body": 4} last = None for key, value in yaml_data.items(): if last is None: last = (key, value) continue # ensure that sections only go up current_section = value['in'] last_section = last[1]['in'] if sections[current_section] < sections[last_section]: self.app.info( "Section out of order. All parameters in section ``%s`` " "should be after section ``%s``. (see ``%s``)" % ( last_section, current_section, last[0])) if (sections[value['in']] == sections[last[1]['in']] and key.lower() < last[0].lower()): self.app.info( "Parameters out of order ``%s`` should be after ``%s``" % ( last[0], key)) last = (key, value) def yaml_from_file(self, fpath): """Collect Parameter stanzas from inline + file. This allows use to reference an external file for the actual parameter definitions. """ lookup = self.load_param_file(fpath)
deleted_lines: def yaml_from_file(self, fpath): """Collect Parameter stanzas from inline + file. This allows use to reference an external file for the actual parameter definitions. """ lookup = yaml.load(stream)

subject: pci: eliminate DB lookup PCI requests during claim
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 19:39:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4b09c59a6af2ca68a9d695dc7737d4d1a7b2e055', 'message': "pci: eliminate DB lookup PCI requests during claim

The nova.pci.manager.PciDevTracker.claim_instance() accepted an Instance
object and called nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance() to
retrieve the PCI requests for the instance. This caused a DB lookup of
the PCI requests for that instance, even though in all situations other
than for migration/resize, the instance's PCI requests were already
retrieved by the resource tracker.

This change removes that additional DB lookup during claim_instance() by
changing the instance parameter to instead be an InstancePCIRequests
object and an InstanceNUMATopology object.

Also in this patch is a change to nova.objects.PciDevice.claim() that
changes the single parameter to an instance UUID instead of an Instance
object, since nothing other than the instance's UUID was used in the
method.

commit_message:
pci: eliminate DB lookup PCI requests during claim

The nova.pci.manager.PciDevTracker.claim_instance() accepted an Instance
object and called nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance() to
retrieve the PCI requests for the instance. This caused a DB lookup of
the PCI requests for that instance, even though in all situations other
than for migration/resize, the instance's PCI requests were already
retrieved by the resource tracker.

This change removes that additional DB lookup during claim_instance() by
changing the instance parameter to instead be an InstancePCIRequests
object and an InstanceNUMATopology object.

Also in this patch is a change to nova.objects.PciDevice.claim() that
changes the single parameter to an instance UUID instead of an Instance
object, since nothing other than the instance's UUID was used in the
method.

Change-Id: I9ab10c3035628f083233114b47b43a9b9ecdd166
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/301308/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance_numa_topology = claim.claimed_numa_topology instance_ref.numa_topology = instance_numa_topology if self.pci_tracker: # NOTE(jaypipes): ComputeNode.pci_device_pools is set below # in _update_usage_from_instance(). self.pci_tracker.claim_instance(context, pci_requests, instance_numa_topology)
deleted_lines: if self.pci_tracker: # NOTE(jaypipes): ComputeNode.pci_device_pools is set below # in _update_usage_from_instance(). self.pci_tracker.claim_instance(context, instance_ref) instance_ref.numa_topology = claim.claimed_numa_topology

revisions:

gate-cinder-tempest-dsvm-glusterfs is broken and

Change-Id: Ib4d245b7606ca8f28b234ee35f00bf39c9bbda7d

commit_message:
devstack-plugin-glusterfs: make the Cinder job non-voting

gate-cinder-tempest-dsvm-glusterfs is broken and
being a voting job for devstack-plugin-glusterfs
it's a blocker for other (non-Cinder-related)
fixes and enhancements of the project.

We can revert this change if the Cinder job is fixed.

Change-Id: Ib4d245b7606ca8f28b234ee35f00bf39c9bbda7d

commit_message:
Code organization cleanup

Use a consistent "sl" prefix for directives and filters to avoid
potential collisions with Horizon or other UI frameworks that might
attempt to use this UI.

Flatten the directory structure and change the module names to match.

Consistently use the module namespace on injectables.

Currently the javascript files are organized according to a Horizon
dashboard pattern and aren't consistently namespaced.  There is little
reason to have the plugin structure follow the Horizon pattern for a
particular dashboard plugin, especially when considering searchlight-ui
may be placed in Project, Admin or outside of any existing dashboard, or
potentially used outside of Horizon entirely.

Implements: blueprint searchlight-ui-modularize
Change-Id: Ib2c906ff0d17f94eb2c668098716e12da13a0bde

commit_message:
Move Bandit job to voting

The bandit commands have been moved to the lint job in
designate's tox.ini file.

As a result we do not need a separate non voting job for it.

Change-Id: Ib93c46844bc29e6902c8ed491f39f58397f73e54
Depends-On: Ic2a8e311b83f03a47b69f16771a6a1b242b8fd03

commit_message:
Properly mock out image_utils operations for tests

Currently image_utils unit tests write data to the "conversion" path.
This should be mocked out rather than interacting with the actual
file system.

Change-Id: I97686de5b2c9c7d2812df6b0576fe6c233e8d9cb
Closes-Bug: #1252502

commit_message:
Correct service_credentials section

The service_credential section variables were renamed at some point
before Mitaka. They are broken in Mitaka and Newton, and possibly
earlier. Additionally some critical variables for dealing with domains
and keystone v3 are missing. This corrects those issues.

A later commit should deprecate some of the naming for things
that have totally different names, like the endpoint_type and
tenant_name, but we need to cleanly (and minimally) backport this to
Mitaka.

Change-Id: I8de5e42102fed2de6bea7bbdd788e86a88f0354c
Closes-Bug: #1581691

subject: WIP Policy definitions in code PoC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 22:25:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d7b8e625b71d1d573ea56205a53ac85bead76116', 'message': "WIP Policy definitions in code PoC

This is a simple approach for defining policy defaults in code. A new
class is added which policies can be registered against and which will
be used for authorization. By moving all authorization through this
class we can be assured that all used policies are captured.

By ensuring that all used policies are defined in the code we can do a
few things:

1. A sample policy file can be generated using the defaults set in the
code. This sample will be exhaustive which the current sample is not.

2. We can generate a list of policies that a user will pass. This is the
starting point of exposing this information in the API so that clients
can know if they're allowed to do something before even attempting it.

However this goes a step beyond that. Some actions require multiple
policies to be checked before it is allowed. A grouping mechanism,
called capabilities, is introduced so that policy can be exposed in a
format that maps well to what users want to do. It can expose things
like 'display_servers' which would indicate that a user can list or show
instances, or something like 'boot_instance' which would indicate that
the user passes the 42 policy checks in that path.

Further work is necessary to load the code defined policy and override
it with config defined policy. And sample file generation.

Change-Id: Id8a1524e8ff4c40fd5ac324a0009c8c54a77c51b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-11 20:08:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', '.gitignore', 'etc/nova/nova-policy-generator.conf', 'nova/api/opts.py', 'nova/cmd/policy_generator.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py', 'nova/policy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3cb12afb6c71998d11461e6f51041fc559f55fd3', 'message': "WIP Policy definitions in code PoC

This is a simple approach for defining policy defaults in code. A new
class is added which policies can be registered against and which will
be used for authorization. By moving all authorization through this
class we can be assured that all used policies are captured.

By ensuring that all used policies are defined in the code we can do a
few things:

1. A sample policy file can be generated using the defaults set in the
code. This sample will be exhaustive which the current sample is not.

2. We can generate a list of policies that a user will pass. This is the
starting point of exposing this information in the API so that clients
can know if they're allowed to do something before even attempting it.

However this goes a step beyond that. Some actions require multiple
policies to be checked before it is allowed. A grouping mechanism,
called capabilities, is introduced so that policy can be exposed in a
format that maps well to what users want to do. It can expose things
like 'boot_instance' which would indicate that the user passes the 42
policy checks in that path.

Further work is necessary to load the code defined policy and override
it with config defined policy. And sample file generation. Currently the
basic rules are not defined like 'admin_or_owner', and the sample file
output lacks sorting or formatting. The sample file can be generated
with the new 'genpolicy' tox target.

Change-Id: Id8a1524e8ff4c40fd5ac324a0009c8c54a77c51b
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Policy definitions in code PoC

This is a simple approach for defining policy defaults in code. A new
class is added which policies can be registered against and which will
be used for authorization. By moving all authorization through this
class we can be assured that all used policies are captured.

By ensuring that all used policies are defined in the code we can do a
few things:

1. A sample policy file can be generated using the defaults set in the
code. This sample will be exhaustive which the current sample is not.

2. We can generate a list of policies that a user will pass. This is the
starting point of exposing this information in the API so that clients
can know if they're allowed to do something before even attempting it.

However this goes a step beyond that. Some actions require multiple
policies to be checked before it is allowed. A grouping mechanism,
called capabilities, is introduced so that policy can be exposed in a
format that maps well to what users want to do. It can expose things
like 'boot_instance' which would indicate that the user passes the 42
policy checks in that path.

Further work is necessary to load the code defined policy and override
it with config defined policy. And sample file generation. Currently the
basic rules are not defined like 'admin_or_owner', and the sample file
output lacks sorting or formatting. The sample file can be generated
with the new 'genpolicy' tox target.

Change-Id: Id8a1524e8ff4c40fd5ac324a0009c8c54a77c51b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/289596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import defaultdict class Policy(object): def __init__(self): self._rules = {} self._capabilities = defaultdict(list) def register(self, rule_defs): # (rule_name, rule, capabilities) for (rule_name, rule, capabilities) in rule_defs: self._rules[rule_name] = rule for capability in capabilities: self._capabilities[capability].append(rule_name) def check_capability(self, context, capability): has_cap = True for rule_name in self._capabilities[capability]: if not enforce(context, rule_name, {'project_id': context.project_id, 'user_id': context.user_id}, do_raise=False): has_cap = False break return has_cap def check_capabilities(self, context): allowed_caps = [] for capability in self._capabilities: if self.check_capability(context, capability): allowed_caps.append(capability) return allowed_caps def authorize(self, context, rule_name): if rule_name in self._rules: return enforce(context, rule_name, {'project_id': context.project_id, 'user_id': context.user_id}, do_raise=False) raise exception.PolicyNotFound(policy=rule_name) POLICY = Policy()

commit_message:
Remove the unused dict_to_keyval and its test

Change-Id: I3d6c0ddf112b7de9a0d6af9cd2b2e18523c04e83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/09/316609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def dict_to_keyval(value, key_base=None): """Expand a given dict to its corresponding key-value pairs. Generated keys are fully qualified, delimited using dot notation. ie. key = 'key.child_key.grandchild_key[0]' """ val_iter, key_func = None, None if isinstance(value, dict): val_iter = six.iteritems(value) key_func = lambda k: key_base + '.' + k if key_base else k elif isinstance(value, (tuple, list)): val_iter = enumerate(value) key_func = lambda k: key_base + '[%d]' % k if val_iter: for k, v in val_iter: key_gen = key_func(k) if isinstance(v, dict) or isinstance(v, (tuple, list)): for key_gen, v in dict_to_keyval(v, key_gen): yield key_gen, v else: yield key_gen, v

commit_message:
Replace _.pluck with _.map

_.pluck is deprecated in the latest Lodash 4.x library.
It's usages should be replaced by _.map not to block Lodash upgrade

Change-Id: Ia5cd76d52f99fc92052466b566e143a93bb4ac05

Remove tempest plugin from non-tempest gate

These were added as a transition, before the real tempest
jobs were created and voting.

commit_message:
Ensure services shutdown during unit testing

* Use stop() instead of kill() in Service fixture.
* Add reset() methods to each rpcapi, and call them after
  shutting down services, allowing for the above to work.

Change-Id: I90a1d9c40fc7f60864cfbfc7c9e47429405bc32c
Closes-Bug: 1411717

subject: Fix Manila RequestContext.to_dict() AttributeError
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-11 21:31:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/5f62f798dad123ded5380a8ff553d958801aaae1', 'message': 'Complete manila request context setup before use

When m-api starts it does an admin context check and sets the
self.is_admin property in the request context accordingly.
The policy check ends up calling into oslo_log using a
dictionary that gets updated with values that are not yet
set and the result is a potentially troubling Error message
and Traceback in the api log.

This patch moves the admin context check a few lines down so
that the needed values have been set and the Error message and
Traceback go away.

Change-Id: I95381cd0e5478e516c0f6a77f1284c3b5b83d492
Closes-Bug: #1561559
Closes-Bug: #1567043
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-13 16:11:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/c917925f77b28c5a07fc395e50d11dfbc33fc438', 'message': 'Fix Manila RequestContext.to_dict() AttributeError

During context initialization RequestContext.to_dict() method
may be triggered before all Manila specific keys have been set
in the context, in which case an AttributeError is triggered.

Fix to_dict() method to set None values for the Manila specific
keys in the context when these attributes have not yet been
set.

Change-Id: I95381cd0e5478e516c0f6a77f1284c3b5b83d492
Closes-Bug: #1561559
Closes-Bug: #1567043
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-13 16:14:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/7a97cf1e9ef9da9789b0986fb1b2b09f3f72b771', 'message': 'Fix Manila RequestContext.to_dict() AttributeError

During context initialization RequestContext.to_dict() method
may be triggered before all Manila specific keys have been set
in the context, in which case an AttributeError is raised.

Fix to_dict() method to set None values for the Manila specific
keys in the context when these attributes have not yet been
set.

Change-Id: I95381cd0e5478e516c0f6a77f1284c3b5b83d492
Closes-Bug: #1561559
Closes-Bug: #1567043
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-14 12:38:36.000000000', 'files': ['manila/context.py', 'manila/tests/test_context.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/f52d032be3760aa432b1bf57faedf52c44c18be6', 'message': 'Fix Manila RequestContext.to_dict() AttributeError

During context initialization RequestContext.to_dict() method
may be triggered before all Manila specific keys have been set
in the context, in which case an AttributeError is raised.

Fix to_dict() method to set None values for the Manila specific
keys in the context when these attributes have not yet been
set.

Change-Id: I95381cd0e5478e516c0f6a77f1284c3b5b83d492
Closes-Bug: #1561559
Closes-Bug: #1567043
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Manila RequestContext.to_dict() AttributeError

During context initialization RequestContext.to_dict() method
may be triggered before all Manila specific keys have been set
in the context, in which case an AttributeError is raised.

Fix to_dict() method to set None values for the Manila specific
keys in the context when these attributes have not yet been
set.

Change-Id: I95381cd0e5478e516c0f6a77f1284c3b5b83d492
Closes-Bug: #1561559
Closes-Bug: #1567043

deleted_lines: if self.is_admin is None: self.is_admin = policy.check_is_admin(self.roles) elif self.is_admin and 'admin' not in self.roles: self.roles.append('admin')

commit_message:
Adds Doctor Driver

This is a new DataSource Driver for Doctor project in OPNFV.
The Driver is a subclass of PushDataSourceDriver.

Change-Id: Iab6418922564dcb950d4a36b5bceeecf68bb6905

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 NTT All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # from __future__ import print_function from __future__ import division from __future__ import absolute_import import mock from congress.datasources import doctor_driver from congress.dse import d6cage from congress import exception from congress.tests import base from congress.tests.datasources import fakes from congress.tests import helper class TestDoctorDriver(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestDoctorDriver, self).setUp() self.doctor = doctor_driver.DoctorDriver('test-doctor') def numbered_string(self, string, number): return string + str(number) def generate_events_objects(self, row_number): objects = [] for i in xrange(0, row_number): obj = { "id": self.numbered_string('id', i), "time": self.numbered_string('time', i), "type": self.numbered_string('type', i), "details": { "hostname": self.numbered_string('hostname', i), "status": self.numbered_string('status', i), "monitor": self.numbered_string('monitor', i), "monitor_event_id": self.numbered_string('event_id', i), } } objects.append(obj) return objects @mock.patch.object(doctor_driver.DoctorDriver, 'publish') def test_events_table(self, mocked_publish): objs = self.generate_events_objects(3) self.doctor.update_entire_data('events', objs) self.assertEqual(3, len(self.doctor.state['events'])) # change elements in state['events'] set to list and sort by id sorted_state = sorted(list(self.doctor.state['events']), key=lambda x: x[0]) for i, row in enumerate(sorted_state): self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('id', i), row[0]) self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('time', i), row[1]) self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('type', i), row[2]) self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('hostname', i), row[3]) self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('status', i), row[4]) self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('monitor', i), row[5]) self.assertEqual(self.numbered_string('event_id', i), row[6])

commit_message:
Fix return value of _clone_image_volume

Callers are looking for an object or None, this should not
return false.

pylint error:
E:1248,30: Instance of 'bool' has no 'id' member (no-member)

Change-Id: I6f2cefb3e62a04b55086f0429194b1b650ee69dc

commit_message:
Overwrite child plugin resource_group_name durning parent registration

Child plugins must live on the same resource group as their
parents. Currently resource_group_name property reads from
config, leaves resource_group_name can be inconsistent with the
parent. Overwrite child plugin's resource group with parent's
resource group during parent registration.

Change-Id: Ib7ace6e0e6badd80e0d82400e4c3d8d72c3b8f3a
Closes-Bug: #1547118

commit_message:
Extend IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE to support 'dib'

This fix avoids the devstack to stop proceeding if
the setting IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE is not coreos or tinyipa.
The change ID I641a5afe8318ec0848395b2b70e056c448f3dd00
forces the stack to stop if IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE is other
than coreos and tinyipa. There is no tar ball which can be
fetched if the IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE is dib.

Closes-Bug: 1567013

added_lines: Gateway Device Management Service --------------------------------- Starting v5.1, MidoNet implements Neutron Gateway Device Management Service extension API. To configure it, add the following service plugin to the `service_plugins` list in the DEFAULT section of `neutron.conf`:: midonet.neutron.services.gw_device.plugin.MidonetGwDeviceServicePlugin L2 Gateway Management Service ----------------------------- Starting v5.1, MidoNet implements Neutron L2 Gateway Management Service extension API. MidoNet plugin implements L2 Gateway Management Service as a service driver. To configure it, add the following entries in the Neutron configuration file `/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``:: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = midonet.neutron.services.l2gateway.plugin.MidonetL2GatewayPlugin In addition to that, configure service providers to the `service_provider` in the service_providers section of L2 Gateway plugin configuration file `/etc/neutron/l2gw_plugin.ini``:: [service_providers] service_provider = L2GW:Midonet:midonet.neutron.services.l2gateway.service_drivers.l2gw_midonet.MidonetL2gwDriver:default

commit_message:
Support datasource names in API

Previously the API datasource model assumed it was being given a
name, but it should be able to accept either a name or an ID.

This fix has the API translate from ID to the name.

Closes-bug: 1581694
Change-Id: I638c4ec130a069555b963f090aa9bbfe466d0349

commit_message:
Add documentation for external network RBAC feature

This adds documentation for the new 'access_as_external' action
that was added in Mitaka to allow Neutron networks to be made
available as external networks to specific projects.

Change-Id: Ia939ba8c0f22a9fd81cb18691cce153dc09d8069
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/04/311904/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Attaching router gateways to networks (since Mitaka).Allowing a network to be used as an external network ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ If a network needs to be made available as an external network for specific projects, the ``access_as_external`` action can be used to avoid making an external network available to all projects. Create a network to make available to a project as an external network: .. code-block:: console $ neutron net-create secret_external_network Created a new network: +---------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +---------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | admin_state_up | True | | availability_zone_hints | | | availability_zones | | | created_at | 2016-04-30T06:51:46 | | description | | | id | f9e39715-f7da-4bca-a74d-fc3675321661 | | ipv4_address_scope | | | ipv6_address_scope | | | mtu | 1450 | | name | secret_external_network | | port_security_enabled | True | | provider:network_type | vxlan | | provider:physical_network | | | provider:segmentation_id | 1073 | | router:external | False | | shared | False | | status | ACTIVE | | subnets | | | tags | | | tenant_id | dfe49b63660e494fbdbf6ad2ca2a810f | | updated_at | 2016-04-30T06:51:46 | +---------------------------+--------------------------------------+ Create the policy entry using the :command:`rbac-create` command (in this example, the ID of the project we want to share with is ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683``): .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-create --target-tenant e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683 \ --action access_as_external --type network f9e39715-f7da-4bca-a74d-fc3675321661 Created a new rbac_policy: +---------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +---------------+--------------------------------------+ | action | access_as_external | | id | c26b3b05-5781-48a1-a36a-fb63072b5e56 | | object_id | f9e39715-f7da-4bca-a74d-fc3675321661 | | object_type | network | | target_tenant | e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683 | | tenant_id | dfe49b63660e494fbdbf6ad2ca2a810f | +---------------+--------------------------------------+ The ``target-tenant`` parameter specifies the project that requires access to the network. The ``action`` parameter specifies what the project is allowed to do. The ``type`` parameter says that the target object is a network. The final parameter is the ID of the network we are granting external access to. Project ``e28769db97d9449da658bc6931fcb683`` will now be able to see the network when running :command:`net-list` and :command:`net-show` and will also be able to create ports on that network. No other users (other than admins and the owner) will be able to see the network. To remove access for that project, delete the policy that allows it using the :command:`rbac-delete` command: .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-delete c26b3b05-5781-48a1-a36a-fb63072b5e56 Deleted rbac_policy: c26b3b05-5781-48a1-a36a-fb63072b5e56 If that project has router gateway ports attached to that network, the server will prevent the policy from being deleted until the ports have been deleted: .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-delete c26b3b05-5781-48a1-a36a-fb63072b5e56 RBAC policy on object f9e39715-f7da-4bca-a74d-fc3675321661 cannot be removed because other objects depend on it. This process can be repeated any number of times to make a network available as external to an arbitrary number of projects. If a network is marked as external during creation, it now implicitly creates a wildcard RBAC policy that shares it with everyone to preserve previous behavior before it was RBAC enabled. .. code-block:: console $ neutron net-create global_external_network --router:external Created a new network: +---------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +---------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | admin_state_up | True | | availability_zone_hints | | | availability_zones | | | created_at | 2016-04-30T07:00:57 | | description | | | id | cb78991c-cdde-445b-a8ca-d819b9266756 | | ipv4_address_scope | | | ipv6_address_scope | | | is_default | False | | mtu | 1450 | | name | global_external_network | | port_security_enabled | True | | provider:network_type | vxlan | | provider:physical_network | | | provider:segmentation_id | 1007 | | router:external | True | | shared | False | | status | ACTIVE | | subnets | | | tags | | | tenant_id | dfe49b63660e494fbdbf6ad2ca2a810f | | updated_at | 2016-04-30T07:00:57 | +---------------------------+--------------------------------------+ In the output above the standard ``router:external`` attribute is ``True`` as expected. Now a wildcard policy will also be visible in the rbac policy listings: .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-list --object_id=cb78991c-cdde-445b-a8ca-d819b9266756 \ -c id -c target_tenant +--------------------------------------+---------------+ | id | target_tenant | +--------------------------------------+---------------+ | 2b72fe2e-20cf-4856-af12-3ac0733604d8 | * | +--------------------------------------+---------------+ This policy can be deleted or modified with the same constraints as any other RBAC ``access_as_external`` policy.

Change-Id: Iffefa69e83a5f77e6413a6758f4c475321e1013d
Related-Bug: #1508908
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/03/255903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def boot_disks(self): # FIXME(agordeev): NVMe drives should be skipped as # accessing such drives during the boot typically # requires using UEFI which is still not supported # by fuel-agent (it always installs BIOS variant of # grub) # * grub bug (http://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/?41883) # NOTE(kozhukalov): On some hardware GRUB is not able # to see disks larger than 2T due to firmware bugs, # so we'd better avoid placing /boot on such # huge disks if it is possible. suitable_disks = [ disk for disk in self.ks_disks if ('nvme' not in disk['name'] and (disk in self.small_ks_disks or not self.small_ks_disks) and self._is_boot_disk(disk)) ] # FIXME(agordeev): if we have rootfs on fake raid, then /boot should # land on it too. We can't proceed with grub-install otherwise. md_boot_disks = [ disk for disk in self.md_os_disks if disk in suitable_disks] if md_boot_disks: return md_boot_disks else: return suitable_disks def _is_boot_disk(self, disk): return any(v["type"] in ('partition', 'raid') and v.get("mount") == "/boot" for v in disk["volumes"]) def _is_os_volume(self, vol): return vol['size'] > 0 and vol['type'] == 'pv' and vol['vg'] == 'os' def _is_os_disk(self, disk): return any(self._is_os_volume(vol) for vol in disk['volumes']) @property def md_os_disks(self): return [d for d in self.ks_disks if d['name'].startswith('md') and self._is_os_disk(d)] @property if disk in self.boot_disks: # we install bootloader only on every suitable disk LOG.debug('Adding bootloader stage0 on disk %s' % disk['name']) parted.install_bootloader = True # legacy boot partition LOG.debug('Adding bios_grub partition on disk %s: size=24' % disk['name']) parted.add_partition(size=24, flags=['bios_grub']) # uefi partition (for future use) LOG.debug('Adding UEFI partition on disk %s: size=200' % disk['name']) parted.add_partition(size=200) and disk in self.boot_disks:
deleted_lines: # we install bootloader on every disk LOG.debug('Adding bootloader stage0 on disk %s' % disk['name']) parted.install_bootloader = True # legacy boot partition LOG.debug('Adding bios_grub partition on disk %s: size=24' % disk['name']) parted.add_partition(size=24, flags=['bios_grub']) # uefi partition (for future use) LOG.debug('Adding UEFI partition on disk %s: size=200' % disk['name']) parted.add_partition(size=200) and (disk in self.small_ks_disks or not self.small_ks_disks): # NOTE(kozhukalov): On some hardware GRUB is not able # to see disks larger than 2T due to firmware bugs, # so we'd better avoid placing /boot on such # huge disks if it is possible.

commit_message:
Skip cleaning of MD containers

Add possibility to skip cleaning of MD containers which are usually
represent fake RAID devices. So, those devices won't be cleaned
and removed at the partitioning step. That will effectively save
those devices for further provisioning purposes.

In order to preserve existing behavior, it will be disabled by
default in conf file.

Will be enabled in a separate patch.

Change-Id: I7be1fc438ffe1fec9b8bfae7e47f50cd3a7c36b7
Related-Bug: #1508908
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/01/255901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove file dmraid2mdadm.cfg

This file is actually a snippet which's configuring default kernel
options for grub2 regarding dmraid/mdadm.

* Remove `nomdadmddf` and `nomdadmism` flags from cmdline of target image
https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel/2014-February/038099.html

Removing of these specific kernel options will let us use mdadm for
Intel Matrix Raid and DDF fakeraid arrays.

We hadn't used dmraid for this kind of stuff, neither had we offered
any kind of support for fake raid prior that change. So, it's safe to
remove those options completely without any doubts.

Change-Id: I682dfd44cad1ef8e993ead79b6dcd345c7b3b322
Related-Bug: #1508908
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/00/255900/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: GRUB2_DMRAID_SETTINGS = 'etc/default/grub.d/dmraid2mdadm.cfg' # enable mdadm (remove nomdadmddf nomdadmism options from cmdline) utils.execute('chroot', chroot, 'dpkg-divert', '--local', '--add', os.path.join('/', GRUB2_DMRAID_SETTINGS)) remove_files(chroot, [GRUB2_DMRAID_SETTINGS])

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 14:27:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/b3b7ac180b7ee5bdc8b0615e1b9e26a21e7a9940', 'message': "Show fake raid devices in Fuel UI

In order to allow nailgun-agent find out fake raid devices:
* MD with 'Raid Level' set to 'container' need to be found,
* undelaying devices from that MD should be filtered out from
  storage devices.

So, if /dev/md127 exists and is actually a contaner, then
* nailgun agent should skip it from reporting as container
  device can't be used as a block device,
* underlaying devices from that container (say, /dev/sda and /dev/sdb)
  shouldn't be reported as storage devices. Logic is simple,
  those devices can't be used too, as they're a part of MD.
* only actual MD (say, /dev/md126) which represent fake raid
  will be reported as a storage device.

commit_message:
Show fake raid devices in Fuel UI

In order to allow nailgun-agent find out fake raid devices:
* MD with 'Raid Level' set to 'container' need to be found,
* undelaying devices from that MD should be filtered out from
  storage devices.

So, if /dev/md127 exists and is actually a contaner, then
* nailgun agent should skip it from reporting as container
  device can't be used as a block device,
* underlaying devices from that container (say, /dev/sda and /dev/sdb)
  shouldn't be reported as storage devices. Logic is simple,
  those devices can't be used too, as they're a part of MD.
* only actual MD (say, /dev/md126) which represent fake raid
  will be reported as a storage device.

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa
Co-Authored-By: Serhii Lystopad <slystopad@mirantis.com>
Related-Bug: #1508908

added_lines: STORAGE_CODES = [3, 8, 9, 65, 66, 67, 68, 69, 70, 71, 104, 105, 106, 107, 108, 109, 110, 111, 202, 252, 253] def _parse_md(data) md = {} h, _, v = data.split(/Number\s+Major\s+Minor\s+RaidDevice\s+(State\s+)?/m) line_patterns = ['Version', 'Raid Level', 'Raid Devices', 'Active Devices', 'Spare Devices', 'Failed Devices', 'State', 'UUID'] for line in h.split("\n")[1..-1] line.strip! next if line == "" line_patterns.each { |pattern| md[pattern] = line.split(" : ").last if line.start_with?(pattern) } end md['devices'] = [] for line in v.split("\n") line.strip! next if line == "" md['devices'] << line.split().last end md end def _find_fake_raid_mds() mds = [] devices = [] Dir["/sys/block/*"].each do |block_device_dir| basename_dir = File.basename(block_device_dir) devname = basename_dir.gsub(/!/, '/') next unless devname.start_with? 'md' # Sample mdadm --detail /dev/md127 output: # /dev/md127: # Version : 1.2 # Creation Time : Thu Oct 29 16:12:00 2015 # Raid Level : raid1 # Array Size : 1048000 (1023.61 MiB 1073.15 MB) # Used Dev Size : 1048000 (1023.61 MiB 1073.15 MB) # Raid Devices : 2 # Total Devices : 2 # Persistence : Superblock is persistent # # Update Time : Sun Nov 1 00:57:31 2015 # State : clean # Active Devices : 2 # Working Devices : 2 # Failed Devices : 0 # Spare Devices : 0 # # Name : agordeev:123 (local to host agordeev) # UUID : 7aa70afc:742a9fa6:45f9f5a1:25a2585f # Events : 20 # # Number Major Minor RaidDevice State # 0 252 2 0 active sync /dev/dm-2 # 1 252 3 1 active sync /dev/dm-3 # md_data = _parse_md(`mdadm --detail /dev/#{devname}`) next if md_data['Raid Level'] == 'container' if md_data.has_key("Container") devices.concat(md_data['devices']) mds << devname end end return mds, devices end mds, devices = _find_fake_raid_mds() # Skipping MD if it's a container. Also skipping underlying # devices from which that container is composed. next if devices.include?("/dev/#{devname}") next if devname.start_with?('md') and not mds.include?(devname) unless properties['DEVPATH'].include?('virtual/block/dm')

commit_message:
Add Designate to tempest available services mechanism

The available services mechanism is currently hardcoded to a list
of projects whos tests have (at some point) been included within
tempest itself, this mechanism needs re-work to support plugins.

In the meantime, add Designate to the list of potential services.

Change-Id: I7baf8d6ebea8ae9dfc5a3296281dfff609bd5860
Depends-On: If7ed86aab42a3e6fea753925b1f31dd08504c635
Related-Bug: 1569562

commit_message:
Add Designate to available services mechanism

The available services mechanism is currently hardcoded to a list
of projects whos tests have (at some point) been included within
tempest itself, this mechanism needs re-work to support plugins.

In the meantime, add Designate to the list of potential services.

Change-Id: If7ed86aab42a3e6fea753925b1f31dd08504c635
Related-Bug: 1569562

commit_message:
Request service token using Identity v3 by default

This patch makes Ironic request its service tokens using Identity v3 by
default (instead of v2) using Password. Old parameters were kept in
order to maintain backwards compatibility. The configuration sample is
also updated.

Change-Id: Ic5527f3053cb4b9cde79eff9ac75f8447909e842
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/296714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Complete public Identity URL for authentication. # (string value) #auth_url=<None> #auth_version=v3.0 # Name of the project Ironic uses to get its service tokens. # (string value) #project_name=service # ID of the user domain. (string value) #user_domain_id=default # ID of the project domain. (string value) #project_domain_id=default # Name of the user Ironic uses to authenticate. # (string value) #username=ironic # Password of the user Ironic uses to authenticate. # (string value) #password=<None>

subject: Make TinyCore mirror configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 15:49:36.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/tinyipa/build-tinyipa.sh', 'imagebuild/tinyipa/finalise-tinyipa.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/a8fafba06ee4962810f40bc4681a3f05069d2256', 'message': 'Make TinyCore mirror configurable

This makes the TinyCoreLinux build mirror configurable, and makes the
default the official repository, http://repo.tinycorelinux.net/. This
mirror consistently tested 15% faster than using ibiblio.org for all
tasks.

Additionally, ensure it is used throughout the build process.
This will allow us to point to an infra-controlled mirror down the
road [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2016-May/004277.html

Change-Id: I03c98517e2e8aa08e18e059c3fe84b7cdef1a3a2
'}]
commit_message:
Make TinyCore mirror configurable

This makes the TinyCoreLinux build mirror configurable, and makes the
default the official repository, http://repo.tinycorelinux.net/. This
mirror consistently tested 15% faster than using ibiblio.org for all
tasks.

Additionally, ensure it is used throughout the build process.
This will allow us to point to an infra-controlled mirror down the
road [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2016-May/004277.html

Change-Id: I03c98517e2e8aa08e18e059c3fe84b7cdef1a3a2

commit_message:
Add reno and release notes tracking

This adds a placeholder file (like every other project has by default),
the source for the sphinx-generated release notes project, and the
appropriate requirements and tox environments.

commit_message:
Added OSLO config framework

This patch adds OSLO config framework required by
neutron-dynamic-routing repository for defining configuration
parameters.

Below changes are done as part of this patch-set:
 - Added OSLO config framework.
 - PEP8 changes for genconfig check.

Change-Id: Id3db0e9c5943ce913f5b2cca8d05a9ade37b3f68
Implements: blueprint bgp-spinout
Partial-Bug: #1560003

commit_message:
Add ldappool to projects.txt for g-r updates/checking

ldappool is a key libary for keystone's ldap integration, this
library is now under the purview of members of the openstack
community and likewise should be checked to ensure the global
requirements are properly managed.

Depends-On: I2539685cc115a5173cdcdeea07ffb0f08036beed
Change-Id: I9cf13a5be63a0abc964c5a6e29c92d16365d89d8

commit_message:
add osc-lib to projects.txt

openstackclient is now publishing a lightweight library (osc-lib)
that other plugins can consume instead of pulling in the complete
openstackclient project.

this library should adhere to global requirements.

Change-Id: Ifc41793f95dd60be32d4cb242aeed9ccd6362d3d

* Remove keys/fsid defaults and add validation

commit_message:
Set Q_L3_ENABLED=False for generic-switch jobs

The job doesn't use Neutron L3 aget.
Starting from [0] if q-l3 is disabled and Q_L3_ENABLED is not set
devstack installation failed.

Reference: [0] https://review.openstack.org/168438/

Change-Id: I3a22ba42c2830a6d35bdefe59de91fcad657d1aa
Closes-Bug: #1581519

commit_message:
Upgrade betamax version

A new version was released, and that is needed for
keystoneauth, to fix the betamax fixture. It needs
the hooks feature, that will allow to manipulate
the interaction data before saving, to mask passwords
and fix the token expiration date.

Change-Id: If68e72e607cb4ad235afbdf63ced951c385b32cd

commit_message:
[WIP]Enable create and delete for segments in ML2

Enabling create and delete for segments through the segment extension
API in ML2.

The logic in this patch mainly comes from [1] & [2]
[1] neutron.plugins.ml2.managers.TypeManager.create_network_segments
[2] neutron.plugins.ml2.managers.TypeManager.release_network_segments

More test will be performed. Meanwhile, reviews are welcomed.

Change-Id: I0a198545ba02e5db25c25355feff763257696075
Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <xiaohhui@cn.ibm.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Temporarily disable OSIC in nodepool

Something has happened to the mirror server in OSIC, so disable that
provider in nodepool temporarily to avoid further broken jobs while
we troubleshoot.

Change-Id: I2e4a8460b82281d40250d012c4a26bff3aac8dbe

commit_message:
[Trivial] Update Neutron resource status list

According to https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/common/constants.py
there are more status values than the list we currently use, we
should update it, otherwise volume will be default -1

Note: update unit test code because we recognize new status now.

Change-Id: Ic6a42fb8a77c6e4fa7ce41cb16ab021cf77f567c

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with WebOb 1.6.0

THe new WebOb release got stricter on the way Response text can be
retrieved for JSON responses. This fixes the issue by checking the body
instead in tests.

Change-Id: I45670bbebda9220ff3e69f10590d20dbc605f4a7

commit_message:
Remove 'u' displayed before subnetpool-list's prefixes

There is useless 'u' in the showing of "neutron subnetpool-list",
Please check bug/1531418 for details.
Add formatter as subnet did in the code.

Change-Id: I4e1502c379032da240ad51cce8be8c1ca558ef15
Closes-Bug: #1531418
(cherry picked from commit 09030171037027d54445a6cfa36481b302373cc4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/81/296581/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _format_prefixes(subnetpool): try: return '\n'.join(pool for pool in subnetpool['prefixes']) except (TypeError, KeyError): return subnetpool['prefixes'] _formatters = {'prefixes': _format_prefixes, }

subject: Skip zone import count test, reenable pool tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-16 12:05:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/29c20c2e4d88dc4fa0097c17b9665d2041da0410', 'message': "Skip zone import tests, reenable pool tests

It looks like we may have found the cause of the CI failures, zone
imports are stated during tests, but are not given time to complete.

This (eventually) means they clash with other tests, causing the
database is locked failures we've been seeing.

commit_message:
Skip zone import count test, reenable pool tests

It looks like we may have found the cause of the CI failures, zone
imports are stated during tests, but are not given time to complete.

This (eventually) means they clash with other tests, causing the
database is locked failures we've been seeing.

Change-Id: I010a32affec54a8f12a4e7f5263a1d20a475d0dc
Closes-Bug: 1570859
Related-Bug: 1582241

commit_message:
Add Mistral to global requirements

This is for use within tripleo-common[0]. Version 2015.1.0 is excluded as pip
detects it as the latest version since mistral changed it's versioning
convention. The current latest version is 2.0.0, which was released over a
year later.

We can remove this when Mistral reaches a major version of 2016!

[0]: https://review.openstack.org/282366

Change-Id: Ibb98013d6ef283bd454f958bb036557d2b02997f

commit_message:
Reset env.encrypted_param_names on stack update

If encryption was enabled when the stack was created but then disabled
when the stack was updated, env.params and env.encrypted_param_names
will be in an inconsistent state.  Ensure that
env.encrypted_param_names is an empty list when encryption is
disabled.

Change-Id: Ife84348bd6b45e1174b3faef72b0b11f3bab2a3f
Closes-Bug: #1572294
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/51/308051/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._check_encrypted_param_names() def _check_encrypted_param_names(self): # If encryption was enabled when the stack was created but # then disabled when the stack was updated, env.params and # env.encrypted_param_names will be in an inconsistent # state if not cfg.CONF.encrypt_parameters_and_properties: self.t.env.encrypted_param_names = []

subject: Use getattr rather than dict access in compare_obj
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 20:56:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/72531679aeb601a10f6f3624ea00274b7208eda0', 'message': 'Use getattr rather than dict access in compare_obj

test_objects.compare_obj ostensibly takes an object and a db
representation of that object and compares them. However it is also
quite useful for passing in two objects for comparison. But the use of
db_obj[db_key] breaks when the object used in the comparison does not
have the DictCompat mixin.

By changing that to getattr(db_obj, db_key) it works both for objects
and dicts.

Change-Id: I2157776a5a0755d6266d2bc669ac55a1f0f27353
'}]
commit_message:
Use getattr rather than dict access in compare_obj

test_objects.compare_obj ostensibly takes an object and a db
representation of that object and compares them. However it is also
quite useful for passing in two objects for comparison. But the use of
db_obj[db_key] breaks when the object used in the comparison does not
have the DictCompat mixin.

By changing that to getattr(db_obj, db_key) it works both for objects
and dicts.

Change-Id: I2157776a5a0755d6266d2bc669ac55a1f0f27353
